documents.title: Learning Goals for 2025
documents.text:
This year I want to focus on:
1. Mastering TypeScript and advanced React patterns
2. Learning system design principles
3. Contributing to open source projects
4. Writing technical blog posts
5. Speaking at at least one conference

documents.title: Book Notes: Clean Architecture
documents.text:
Key takeaways from Uncle Bob's Clean Architecture:
- Dependencies should point inward
- Business rules are the core of the system
- Frameworks are details, not the architecture
- The architecture should be testable without external dependencies

documents.title: Side Project Ideas
documents.text:
Brainstorming new project ideas:
- Personal finance tracker with investment analysis
- AI-powered code review assistant
- Location-based social network for developers
- Automated testing framework for APIs
- Markdown-based knowledge management system

documents.title: Conference Talk Proposal
documents.text:
Title: 'Building Resilient Frontend Applications'
Abstract: Explore patterns and practices for building React applications that gracefully handle failures, network issues, and edge cases. Cover error boundaries, retry logic, and progressive enhancement.
Target audience: Frontend developers with 2+ years experience

documents.title: Interview Preparation Notes
documents.text:
System design concepts to review:
- Load balancing strategies
- Database sharding and replication
- Caching patterns (Redis, CDN)
- Message queues and pub/sub
- Monitoring and observability
- Security best practices

documents.title: Productivity Optimization
documents.text:
Trying new productivity techniques:
- Pomodoro Technique: 25 min focus + 5 min break
- Time blocking for deep work
- Digital minimalism: checking email only 2x/day
- Using Notion for task management and note-taking
- Early morning coding sessions (6-8 AM)

documents.title: Open Source Contribution Plan
documents.text:
Projects I want to contribute to:
1. React DevTools - fix accessibility issues
2. Next.js - improve documentation
3. TypeScript - help with community issues
4. Prettier - add new formatting options
5. Create my own CLI tool for developers
